title: Boy, 16, shot in Wilmington Wednesday night
content:
A 16-year-old boy was shot in the leg Wednesday night after city police said he complied with two robbers' demands.
City officers responded to the area of Linden and S. Van Buren streets in reference to a Shot Spotter Alert, according to the Wilmington Police Department. There, police found a boy suffering from a gunshot wound inside the corner store on Linden Street, according to a spokesperson with the department.
The boy was treated on scene by New Castle County Paramedics and then taken to the A.I. DuPont Children's Hospital, police said. He is now in stable condition.
The victim was approached by two unknown black males wearing dark-colored clothing, police say, who demanded his belongings.
After the victim complied, police said he began to flee.
As he fled, however, the victim heard gunfire and realized that he had been struck, police said.
The investigation remains ongoing. Anyone with information relative to this investigation is asked to call Detective Jose Santana at (302) 576-3620.
